ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Mixed hearing loss (Right ear)
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Significant air-bone gaps present with history of radiation, surgery, and tympanic membrane perforation.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Tympanic membrane perforation (Right ear)
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Tympanometry revealed a flat trace with a very large ear canal volume (7.1 mL) and history of drainage.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Sensorineural hearing loss (Left ear)
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Air and bone conduction thresholds are consistent with no air-bone gaps; Type A tympanogram.

ordered_list.rationale_short: To determine the degree, configuration, and type of hearing loss bilaterally.
To assess speech reception thresholds and word recognition abilities.
To evaluate middle ear function, particularly given the reported perforation.
To assess the integrity of the auditory pathway and middle ear status.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: The right ear exhibits a moderately severe to profound mixed hearing loss with a large air-bone gap. Tympanometry confirms a perforated tympanic membrane in the right ear due to large canal volume. The left ear shows a slight sloping to severe sensorineural hearing loss with normal middle ear function. Speech recognition is fair in the right ear and good in the left.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Right ear: Moderately severe sloping to severe mixed loss (250-4000 Hz), profound at 8000 Hz. Left ear: Slight sloping to moderate sensorineural loss (250-2000 Hz), sloping to severe at high frequencies.

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: Right: SRT 75 dB, WRS 66% (moderate difficulty). Left: SRT 40 dB, WRS 84% (slight difficulty).

tests.name: Tympanometry
tests.result_summary: Right: Flat tympanogram with large ear canal volume (7.1 mL), consistent with perforation. Left: Normal (Type A).

tests.name: Acoustic reflexes
tests.result_summary: Right: Absent ipsilateral and contralateral. Left: Ipsilateral present at 500-1000 Hz, absent at higher frequencies and contralateral.

proposed_items: Hearing aid evaluation pending medical clearance
counseling_actions: Discuss the presence of mixed hearing loss and eardrum perforation in the right ear.
Advise on the necessity of medical clearance from an ENT before hearing aid fitting.
Instruct to keep the right ear dry to prevent further infection.

red_flags_present: Intermittent drainage from the right ear

escalation.rationale_short: For treatment of recurring ear infection, perforated tympanic membrane, and to provide medical clearance for hearing aids.

follow_up_plan.objective: Re-evaluation of hearing and hearing aid evaluation.
